title: Get started
text: function allows user estimate maximal AUC based population prevalence (K) proportion variance explained (pve). , can use example type II diabetes provided original manuscript:

title: Authors and Citation
text: Levin M (2022). prsperf: Estimate Theoretical Performance PRS. https://github.com/mglev1n/prsperf, https://mglev1n.github.io/prsperf/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {prsperf: Estimate Theoretical Performance Of PRS},   author = {Michael Levin},   year = {2022},   note = {https://github.com/mglev1n/prsperf, https://mglev1n.github.io/prsperf/}, }

title: Estimate Theoretical Performance Of PRS
text: goal prsperf provide set functions estimate performance characteristics polygenic risk scores specified conditions. Functions adapted : Dreyfuss, Jonathan M., Daniel Levner, James E. Galagan, George M. Church, Marco F. Ramoni. “Accurate Can Genetic Predictions ?” BMC Genomics 13, . 1 (July 24, 2012): 340. https://doi.org/10.1186/1471-2164-13-340.

title: Estimate Theoretical Performance Of PRS
text: can install development version prsperf GitHub :

title: Estimate the Maximum AUC — max_auc
text: Estimate maximum AUC polygenic risk score based population prevalence disease k proportion variability explained PRS pve.

title: Estimate the Maximum AUC — max_auc
text: k (numeric; range 0-1) Population prevalence disease interest pve (numeric; range 0-1) Proportion variability explained PRS n.bins (integer) Number bins estimating AUC (default = 100)
